subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Uncoupling and Longevity Evolution Theory
Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Turnover Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial free radical (ROS) generation causing oxidative damage to mtDNA driving aging.
Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS production causing oxidative damage and aging.
Highlights balance of mitochondrial ROS production and removal affecting aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS generation and oxidative damage as aging drivers.
Describes adaptive evolution reducing mitochondrial ROS production to extend lifespan.
Focuses on mitochondrial complex I ROS production and oxidative stress in aging.
Links mtDNA deletions causing ETC dysfunction and increased ROS driving aging.
Mitochondrial dysfunction increases mtROS causing inflammaging and immunosenescence.
mtDNA deletions cause mitochondrial enzymatic dysfunction and ROS-related cardiac aging.
Accumulation of heteroplasmic mtDNA mutations in NADH dehydrogenase genes increases ROS and aging.
Mitochondrial genetic variation affects ROS production and mitochondrial dysfunction in aging.
Focuses on mtDNA haplotype evolution and mitonuclear epistasis shaping lifespan.
Adaptive selection of mtDNA-coded protein mutations reduces ROS and extends longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Uncoupling and Longevity Evolution Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial uncoupling increasing proton leak to reduce ROS and extend lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Uncoupling and Longevity Evolution Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mild mitochondrial uncoupling reduces ROS production and preserves mitochondrial function with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Uncoupling and Longevity Evolution Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Uncoupling to survive hypothesis posits decreased membrane potential lowers ROS and promotes longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Turnover Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA turnover rate affecting mutation accumulation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Turnover Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Age-related accumulation of mtDNA deletions impairs ETC and contributes to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Turnover Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Somatic mtDNA mutations accumulate and clonally expand causing mitochondrial dysfunction in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Turnover Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Cryptic mtDNA mutations accumulate in single cells causing mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Turnover Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Heteroplasmy variance increases with age and generations, influencing mtDNA mutation load and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Protein Heterogeneity and Fragmentation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mitochondrial fragmentation causes protein distribution heterogeneity disrupting mitochondrial function.
Mitochondrial dysfunction triggers mitokine release modulating immune aging and inflammaging.
Low-level mitochondrial ROS induce beneficial adaptive responses promoting longevity.
Mild mitochondrial stress triggers retrograde signaling and mitokine release enhancing lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Metabolic Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mitochondrial metabolic decline, NAD+ depletion, and altered signaling pathways drive aging.
